channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report E-2023080052
item.description:
Report E-2023080052

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-01
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 60 pound pail of accutab si (un2880)had been damaged and had released 25 pounds of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

Report X-2023080255

  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHEN THIS PACKAGE STARTED LEAKING, I WAS CALLED TO THE AREA I TOLD THE PACKAGE HANDLERS TO STOP WORKING IN THE AREA UNTILL, I CLEANED IT UP. DescribePack: ALL CANS WERE DENTED I FOUND PUNCTURE HOLS OM THE SIDE OF THE CAN ABOUT THE SIZE OF A PEN HEAD DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I CLEAND UP WHAT LEAKED OUT I PLACED THE DAMAGED CANS IN A TOTE TO PREVENT ANY OTHER PACKAGES FROM BEING CONTAMINATED.

item.title: Report X-2023080216
item.description:
Report X-2023080216

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet during loading process, was put into a lined hazmat tote and taken to our hazmat cage and put under the exhaust vent. DescribePack: The caps on the inner containers were loose causing the inner containers to leak and damage package. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed with orientation arrows pointing up and put into lined hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2023080192
item.description:
Report X-2023080192

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: YUMA
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being unloaded when package handler notice a wet spot on package. Package was placed in a hazmat tote to prevent damage/injury. DescribePack: Gallon had loose caps. No clips/tape was used to secure the lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately place in a hazmat tote in the upright position to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023070554
item.description:
Report X-2023070554

  • City: TUCSON
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO DOOR FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE CALL. WEARING PPE AND UTILIZING DECISION TREE, RESPONDER OBSERVED A PACKAGE THAT HAD A SMALL STAIN AND HAD A SMELL COMING FROM IT. THE INNER CONTAINERS WERE LEAKING. THE INNER CONTAINERS WERE IN A CLEAR PLASTIC BAG. RESPONDER PROCESSED THE PACKAGE WITHOUT INCIDENT.

item.title: Report X-2023080081
item.description:
Report X-2023080081

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was being unloaded when it slipped out of a package handler hands. making it land upside down causing the lid to become loose and leak. Hazmat was then placed in a red tote lined with a hazmat bag and brought to QA for proper processing. DescribePack: The cap on the nitric acid easily loosens, causing it to leak and wet the side of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was put in a yellow drum and lined with a hazmat bag to prevent any leaks from happening.

item.title: Report E-2023070932
item.description:
Report E-2023070932

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPH experienced a UN3105 NOROX MEKP-900 release from 8 boxes each containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released impacting their boxes and dock floor in a 3' x 3' due to loose lids on the jugs. A total of 32 bottles were found damaged and containerized into a 30-gallon and 55-gallon vented poly drums. Absorbent pads were utilized to clean the released product. The impacted rags, cardboard, and cleanup debris were then placed into a separate 55-gallon vented poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023070387
item.description:
Report X-2023070387

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO CALL OF A 5 GALLON METAL BUCKET. THE BUCKET WAS DENTED ON THE LID AND LEAKED, THERE WAS NO OUTER PACKING. RESPONDER RESPONDED TO, TRANSPORTED AND PROCESSED THE PACKAGE WEARING PPE AND UTILIZING DECISION TREE.

item.title: Report X-2023070312
item.description:
Report X-2023070312

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: TUCSON
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE CALL IN THE UNLOAD WEARING PPE AND UTILIZING DECISION TREE. WHILE RESPONDING TO THE PACKAGE RESPONDER OBSERVED A 5GAL PLASTIC INNER CONTAINER LABELLED FLAMMABLE LIQUID 3, UN1219, ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL, CONTACTED HMSC TO CONFIRM UNDECLARED. THE INNER CONTAINER WAS SLIGHTLY LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE. THERE WERE NO INNER PACKAGING AND LABELS ON THE OUTER CARTON.
